alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Marion; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Alachua, northeastern Marion and west central Putnam Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sparr, or near Citra, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, pea size hail, and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Fort McCoy, Citra, Sparr, Anthony, Orange Springs, Reddick and Hog Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Marion; Western Putnam
